4AboeOjbBstQfRbLHhnAhg.text: This was my local coffee stop when I stayed on this street recently and it was a big highlight of the trip.Got a takeaway one morning (where I learned that a 'roll and bacon' doesn't exist) and a lovely sit-in job another.My 'bacon butty' was three slices of toasted bread (white and brown) cut into triangles in a box. At least four slices of thick bacon in there. Proper sorted me out!Cooked breakfast sitting in was also excellent, and good value for money.A nice clean sleek interior with funky decorations and books will make you feel right at home.Note: breakfast served only until 10.30 during the week (12.30 at weekend).Recommended.

JOwXHYM80p9t7INEmyRskg.text: I was in the area and looking for a place to grab a quick lunch before heading over to the British Library, and after searching through Yelp, I decided to make a detour and head to this little coffee house. It was cold & dreary, but I am very glad I made my way there! For a small coffee house, they have quite the sandwich/lunch selection, and after a few minutes, I went with a latte and a pesto, avocado sandwich. The latte was delicious, and the sandwich was easily the best of its kind that I have ever had, which is quite the compliment from a strict carnivore!I would definitely return if I was in the area.

6stiTZRwxr8V41CfvIH8rQ.text: Situated down the stairs of Tavistock is this cosy little coffee house. People come here for coffee, lunch, or even to study. Staff are always friendly and the coffee is quality. Perfect for a quick escape from the buzz of the street

ydP1zAEy7KSuhr0WmGt75g.text: Checked this place out based on Yelp reviews below and was not disappointed. Excellent coffee, brewed to perfection. Friendly staff. Nice atmosphere. Cakes looked pretty damn good too, but I resisted the temptation (on this occasion anyway).

ICNfYn143kUX0LK2cWMmdw.text: Great little place! Stopped one morning for breakfast. Had some avocado on toast, delicious, a couple of cakes and some coffee. Everything was just right. Friendly service and a cozy warm atmosphere make it the perfect place to start your day.

akZNDnXSv0ioQnEH7iro9A.text: Cute little place. Great friendly service. Yummy food! I will definitely be back.

-JR1js1zRZAiKh_Ani5GcQ.text: Cute place. Tucked away in a basement, nice decor on the interior, nice bathroom, good soup and artisan bread, only the wifi didn't work, and the staff said it doesn't work for macs only. Also, unlike a previous review, they don't have pastries to speak of, just one quiche.If you want to go somewhere cute and don't have a need for wifi (mac owners), I'd recommend this place.

G_G5cB_VL745jjWwARR06Q.text: Hidden gym down a set of stairs. Great coffee and snacks if you're in the area.

CjSpARPmRVbDT-BrYa4uBA.text: Aside from having strange hours, I love everything about the Bloomsbury Coffee House. They offer a variety of sweets, food options, and of course, coffee. The place can be a bit hard to find but just keep an eye out for a large black easel atop a beautifully mosaic-ed stoop.

jhiKI3vRW4H4-tvy2yMnFA.text: I wandered into this place thinking that I had discovered the new frontier of hipster cafes, hidden away under a dodgy looking Bloomsbury hotel in an ironic and self aware fashion. how wrong was I. The coffee is mediocre at best (although the only alternatives within a short walking distance are Starbucks and full English-breakfast-type places), the place stinks of sewage and the pastries look far from fresh. Service was courteous and prompt. But the coffee is all that really matters, and it's not v good. I would recommend going to the store street espresso or the espresso room, both about 12 minutes walk from here.

7XWqdO2-Hm6FGBDnB7o7zg.text: Lovely place, love the vintage decor and music vibe. Student discount available. They recently extended their hours as well - closes at 5:30 on weekdays!

tWUTQAONENzcDVU71V6k6Q.text: I'm tempted to keep this place to myself, but this coffeehouse is too lovely to ignore!  This is my absolute favorite neighborhood hangout.  I love to come here for breakfast and coffee in the mornings while I work on my computer (free Wi-Fi!), and the food is delicious. More than that, the people who work here are really friendly, and they make me feel welcome every time I arrive.  There's plenty of space, so it never feels exceptionally crowded, and it's really quiet and cozy -- mainly because it's not on a main street.  They're doing a wonderful job, and I want this place to stick around for a long time! STUDENT DISCOUNT!

3Izdez9DMkSHnXWrPEQ5zg.text: student update: 10% discount, can get on the eduroam netowkr, plugs, toilets.

ujiZb_CLkGvvKm0rhJQOgA.text: Bloomsbury Coffee House, how I miss thee! This cozy coffee shop serves up incredibly fresh food, and baked treats, and also smoothies! They make lunch as well but we never got to try their sandwiches as our study abroad group of students was out of the area early morning. The staff at BCH accommodated our large group for almost a full week and allowed us to reserve their back room larger tables for our group of college students.  Daily porridge and an Americano for me got the day off right.  The staff is incredibly friendly, the food fresh, the ambiance is perfection... and they have free wifi for the internet junkies out there! Thank you times 1 million to BCH. should I return to London (I hope), you will definitely be one of first stops!

tb7simXd9pxt7FlnP57Lmw.text: Cute coffee shop with some nice meals, breakfast is a little small but the food is delicious

wyYLQHIWfJX9WUzmz2Lu6w.text: Nice friendly cafe with good food and juices. The haloumi falafel warm sandwich was flavorful and just big enough. A side green salad and a carrot ginger juice helped take the edge off jet lag without shocking the system.  And the price was very reasonable and the free WiFi let me map my way to the British Library.

te8V1L-N36ZOAyQHB3hRYw.text: Fine place to sit but not sure why all the awesome reviews.  Coffee fine. Pastries poor. Lovely people. Nice place to chat if you live nearby but I'd never go out of my way to go here again.

SjUKE0L0__nSNxDr79uv_Q.text: Sometimes your usual breakfast routine just won't cut it. You yearn for something that's above average. Bloomsbury Coffee House is your new destination for a delicious breakie. The coffee house is located on the basement level so make sure u don't miss the entrance. Just take a seat, look at their extensive morning menu with everything from Full English (6.95 £) to banana spelt loaf (4.35 £) and order at the counter.I ordered the creamy vanilla porridge with chia seed mix (5.25 £) while my travel buddy decided to go for the homemade granola  (4.75 £). The porridge was a healthy, heartwarming and filling way to start my day. The portion was quite generous too. The granola was - according to my travel sidekick - the best granola she ate in London!

hBQ8nVKx9HQIQxPhFVRpNQ.text: Nice little breakfast place! But it's easy to miss because it is located DOWNSTAIRS!!! Breakfast and coffee are very good! Everything is so fresh, especially the eggs and veggies! There's free wifi too! I'll love to sit a long day... but need to visit the town... would love to go there again! highly recommended!

YO2eBkEEzdINVYtDLLSoKg.text: Really nice pretty coffee place. I went to a conference to UCL and had breakfast here every morning. Really enjoyed it, good stuff and nice place to relax in the morning.

Zw_L6VgNG_rBc_D0tYcXmg.text: Came across this place while visiting London and ended up coming here three times during my five day stay. Food is great, drinks are great, and atmosphere is great. 10/10 would recommend.  The chai made me cry tears of joy.

6YsPaRr4xkdVJOIC6lZkzA.text: Quaint little place in London. Excellent for breakfast. It's attached to a hotel and was quite full when we got there (around 11am). We had the avocado toast (pretty good) and the full English Breakfast but the best part were the teas on offer. Recommended.

jii6v7WqkjHhHU0INxMYHg.text: Preh.cious. Needed to meet a friend around Russell Square and this came up for an option that was open on a Saturday afternoon. I got there, thinking it was closed, only to realise that the entrance is actually on the basement level and had to go down some stairs first! Lovely homely atmosphere and I ordered a chilli chai latte that wasn't too strong on the chilli, but quite delicious. Stayed for about an hour and a half, but feel like this place would be great to do some remote working in as well.

v3OeoBZ23zJqJSdTZr003A.text: Fantastic coffee, friendly staff, nice atmosphere and well price. What more do you need in a coffee shop!

cv2yniwnhCTjVCeEki0r8w.text: An unpretentious little cafe in Bloomsbury, with good music, fast wifi and great food (I haven't Tried the coffee but the goat's cheese quiche is amazing).Staff are nice and welcoming. Great for talking or studying. Highly recommended!

YFbFu0jgObUPzsFSK_sTxA.text: Nice place to settle down away from the hubbub on the street-level!Came here for a bite to eat on Sunday morning, they have several breakfast items available, and echoing another review, it's not too different than what you can make at home, but the ample seating and tasty coffee (got a macchiato) makes this a solid place to visit.

V9OzaWMabdPi2sfR4O94Gw.text: Lovely coffee, beautiful location. Cosy, quirky cafe hidden away in the midst of Bloomsbury. They also sell salads, sandwiches, soups (the lunch menu changes daily), smoothies, juices, teas, and the highlight- freshly baked goods. (Two words- cinnamon buns.)Definitely worth a visit!

-69MWpT8w0VsIFBkQQMt6A.text: Absolutely love this place. Was meeting up with a friend in euston/king's cross area and it was up to me to choose a place. I opted for Bloomsbury Caffe as the reviews were great and it was inbetween the two stations so good location. I found it pretty easy to get to but my friend didn't :(. I ordered a tea pigs chai latte with soy milk which was lovely and my friend ordered an Americano which he really enjoyed. The coffee shop is really cute. I did find that when it gets busy you will bump into the people on the next table. The tables are quite close together which can be uncomfortable when its busy. All in all a great place and somewhere I will definitely come back.

cFmrYpdDtg2SWnF9X5sR1A.text: English breakfast was pretty cheap and filling. I'll be honest and say there wasn't anything too special about it-most people could probably cook a similar meal at home. But I guess the appeal is that it tastes home cooked :) the other thing that was a little annoying is they don't let you choose what tea or coffee drink to come along with the full English breakfast...they charge you extra for anything besides English breakfast tea or regular coffee.Overall a good cafe: good food, good drinks, good atmosphere, and they even have wifi!

EwetmbAaavNWvHAcAupxMw.text: Hidden away in Bloomsbury, this place had great coffee and nice service. Ps. Free wifi and it's open by 8am on Sunday mornings. Great spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Bloomsbury Coffee House - London, United Kingdom. Lattes. Delicious.

W0RFx6rNzP1xMe-7gP5FkQ.text: £2 for a bottomless cup of filter coffee. It's just like being back in the States, score. And for this reason, I am currently unable to comment on the quality of their espresso drinks, perhaps I will eventually be persuaded to deter from this novel (for London) treat.Breakfast was delicious. I would say a little bit pricey for the portion size but certainly tasty. The porridge had the apposite texture (indicative of proper overnight oat-soaking), the potato cakes which accompanied the scrambled eggs were more akin to pancakes in texture and appearance but still enjoyable.Not much seating space inside as the place is tiny, but if you do grab a spot it certainly feels cosy being sunken from street level. It's actually the breakfast cafe of the hotel above but it nicely maintains an independent cafe atmosphere.

XQmKqBPRUeouy3Z5u3sg9g.text: A nice and student-frienly coffee shop. Nice baked goods as well. Many seats so no fears of being asked to chage you seat for  groups.

gOBMByfUIMFEZRp5-tYN6g.text: Definitely a cute little cafe with portions big enough to fill you up! The food is high quality and the people are friendly. Free wifi a plus too!

bHfUk3Qhh5XH62SUiAPPVQ.text: I actually wanted to move to London after eating in this coffee shop in May 2017. I'm back.  I found out immediately that my favorite pastry chef is on maternity leave. Key:  come after 11:30 to eat all the amazing salads and veggie items.  The breakfast is just ho-hum. But the salads, the quiches, the baked goods that the pastry chef used to make, these were delicious. I hope she comes back!!!!  The coffee, with whole organic milk, also is worth coming back for.  While I was writing this review, a wonderful staff member saw that I did not like my breakfast and came and REPLACED it with the very salads that I was longing to try.  So I think the staff alone have led me to give a full five star review. While I'm writing this a little message that says that my review is making the "yelposphere" a better place. I do respect yelp's commitment to an objective viewpoint and that is why I usually turn to yelp when I'm looking for a place to eat or drink in a strange city.

E8VnB0Eh27KIjUDzRDWbdg.text: One of the many nice cafes tucked away in Bloomsbury. I love stopping here for a quick snack after class. They have a selection of salads fresh everyday and pastries. My favorite are the blondies - chewy, crumbly, and not too sweet if paired with a black coffee. The first time I stumbled upon this cafe, it was admitted the color mosaic stair fronts along many doorways on Tavistock Street that caught my eye. Bloomsbury Coffee House is actually downstairs, below street level. There is probably two tables in the outdoor downstairs. There is more seating indoors that spans two rooms. Overall, how would I describe the ambiance? Sweet and cozy. Perfect for discussing schoolwork over a cuppa.

photos.caption: Photo of Bloomsbury Coffee House - London, United Kingdom. Blondie, London Fog, Mocha

PPJiZT-m3T0D69F8ZIcT1Q.text: Delightful coffee shop with more options than one would expect. Food was good, atmosphere was great. Quick and accurate service. Loved the wood that lines the coffee house. Would recommend to a friend!

photos.caption: Photo of Bloomsbury Coffee House - London, United Kingdom

EMVUZPNkRvk-iuRwUDaUkQ.text: Cute spot, but inside is quite dark and doesn't feel quite clean. Got a chorizo-spinach-caramelized onion frittata + side salad: staff was sweet and efficient, but food was strangely icy-cold and too salty.

bF5MEumzXHrsGbu6b7QgBA.text: Very cute little place. I had the smashed avocado on sourdough with poached egg and halloumi cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of Bloomsbury Coffee House - London, United Kingdom

piZmccEX3yHhto-ulUafwg.text: Cute little place. So much zen. Namastay here all day!Quiet cosy basement cafe with a good selection of cakes and savouries. Perfect for someone who's looking for small nibbles and drinks. They do have a variety of fresh sandwiches available from 11am - 3pm, ranging from smoked salmon, grilled Haloumi, chicken and honey roasted ham. There are vegetarian options such as tarts, quiches and salads. Decent prices!! Could get a meal with drinks below £10 here, rare in London. Outdoor seating is limited, fits 3 couples max (tables of 2). The inside is a wider, and could fit more but it's definitely not a place for big groups or anything more than 3. Seems more like a takeaway kind of place... If you manage to get a seat outside that would be perfect! Especially when the weather is nice and sunny. You do get a bit of noise from the cars driving pass and from pedestrians. If you'd like to get some work done it would be best to be seated inside, though I found it a little hot and humid.

photos.caption: Photo of Bloomsbury Coffee House - London, United Kingdom. Seating inside
Photo of Bloomsbury Coffee House - London, United Kingdom. Selection of home made sweet cakes
Photo of Bloomsbury Coffee House - London, United Kingdom. Selection of salads and savouries

Nxc1cvtFh6_4mN8klg_0rQ.text: I didn't actually buy anything here but followed a friend. The interior is quite small but feels cozy. There are both drink and food (lunch/brunch style) menu. As a non-British, it kind of felt like this would be one of the places where you can taste and experience typical "British" style food, tea drinks, and ambience. Not sure if this makes sense though haha.

photos.caption: Photo of Bloomsbury Coffee House - London, United Kingdom. Hidden under the stairs

5UFuKne8Fei-HVmIhA8AAA.text: Yet another lovely little coffee shop nestled in the Bloomsbury area. Be sure to look for the sign, because the shop is actually downstairs. The inside is so cozy and warm, with a huge display of all sorts of delicious food: sandwiches, salads, quiches, pastries, etc. I went for a sandwich that came with chicken, mozzarella, tomato, and pesto. It came on some kind of dark multigrain bread, and was delicious. I also had a latte, which was great as well. Their cinnamon roll is also to die for. Its a great spot to sit and read or get some work done, but does tend to be busy. The staff is very friendly and great at what they do. Overall, a really nice little place for a sip and a bite.

t16fMVONoI2azQby3HnBHw.text: Went here recently hungry and tired from walking straight from St Pancras- so glad I stumbled in here! Had a coffee with cream and an egg/bacon/cheese muffin sandwich. Finally a place that serves real thick crisp pieces of bacon, not the soggy sad stuff! Good for a small but tasty breakfast and coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Bloomsbury Coffee House - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bloomsbury Coffee House - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bloomsbury Coffee House - London, United Kingdom

nJW7O8DowbP82b5p_AbGVQ.text: Cute place, but I waited almost 40 minutes for one americano. I really enjoyed the atmosphere but the service could have been better.

Ae8YibbWmyxKBvMe1UdfrQ.text: Hey Bloomsbury Coffee as soon as I walked by it was love at first sight. Then I saw the words 'Chilli Chai Latte' and the rest is history. Cute little place that you'd blink and miss it. Discreet entrance due to fact you have to go down a little stairs. Front room is airy and light though I moved to back where it was much more packed sitting. A lot of students possibly because of nearby uni students. Lot of people eating too so might be quite cheap but didn't check. Seems to be an in the know popular place as it kept getting more crowded and this was random time during the day. Overall it's a cute little place to spend time in with good quick wi Fi with a good coffee. Nice atmosphere inside too.

photos.caption: Photo of Bloomsbury Coffee House - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bloomsbury Coffee House - London, United Kingdom

BLesp00Uy-r5l19Cs73Kqw.text: Great little spot for breakfast while we were in town. Reasonable prices, nice staff, and good food! Can get in and out in about 45 minutes, but can also linger when you have more time. The coffees, granola yogurt, and full English were great.

IbCnIiWpstSVg3aGfTNC4Q.text: One week into my year in London, and I've found the first place I really love.  Second time here, and it's a mixture of kind hospitality and good food and coffee. Plus a student discount and wifi. What more could I ask for?

mHeamMYetmfQDYIVaLAqFQ.text: All during my trip throughout the United Kingdom, my lady and I stayed in guest houses that included breakfast.  And, of course, most of them were the Full English kind (made vegetarian).  None of these homemade breakfasts made with love (or at least putting up with tourists) came even close to the one I had the first day off the plane at this coffee shop.Located in the middle of a row of hotels and hostels in a basement a slight walk from the British Library, this place is a treat.  There are two comfortable rooms of varying side bar stools and tables with cafe service.  We were able to sit and drink lots of English Breakfast tea with (lots of) sugar in an attempt to get over jet lag.  They provide the adorable little tea service that many other coffee shops do in an atmosphere conducive to studying or chatting or pretty much anything but sleeping.The prices are wonderful for the giant portions they offer on their Full English.  The 6.95 we paid for food made it possible to completely skip lunch.  I would have loved another veggie sausage since they was delicious (I actually got an extra one because I requested no mushrooms and they will make substitutions) but it's not like my stomach needed it.  My lady could not even finish her delicious halloumi cheese sandwich.  While I will probably not have a chance to frequent this place ever again, I can't recommend it to locals looking for breakfast and tea enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Bloomsbury Coffee House - London, United Kingdom. Not actual size.  Though it would be cool if it was.
Photo of Bloomsbury Coffee House - London, United Kingdom. Look down of you're going to miss this wonderful coffee shop.

jmEvbr2CJL6-0Z0nM5V79A.text: I'm really sorry, I'm really sorry, I think I just have the February grumps?I'm just feelin' 3 stars here. And I gave it two go-s!I like the Bloomsbury Coffee House, but people had _really_ hyped up its appeal. I went mid-afternoon on a weekday to do some work, and it was pretty busy given the fact that it was surprisingly (mainly) hidden from street view (it's down a flight of stairs and below street level). A lot of students, which makes sense given the location. It has a great buzz, though I guess "great" depends on what kind of work you're hoping to tackle (FINAL STAGES OF THESIS YOU SAY? CUE CATHY COMIC-STYLE: GACK GACK GACK!!!).I like the look of a lot of things on offer: bircher muesli. Quinoa salad. Plenty of veggie-friendly options in the form of quiches. But I've never stuck around. I've been in twice; both for takeaway. Once for a chai latte and a brownie; the other time for a slice that was chock-a-block full (unexpectedly) of marshmallows. It's cute, it's warm, I (in my limited time in the space given the takeaway) had friendly service...it just...was kinda meh. Both baked goods were fine, but overly sweet for my taste and nothing truly righteous. And I appreciate the range of hot drinks on their menus (a great place to bring someone who isn't a coffee lover; teas and tea lattes and hot chocolates), but the chai latte wasn't my fave. I think part of my feelings for Bloomsbury Coffee House is unfortunately coloured by my love of other coffee-and-cake options right around the Judd Street / Tavistock Place intersection. So if it were stand-alone? Maybe you'd get 3.5 stars. I just feel like there are tastier, more affordable on-point-ier options just around the corner (I feel like it's bad manners to point 'em out, but if you read my reviews they ain't tough to identify).Yelp note: I'm totally willing to give their more extensive food menu a go. They make everything on premises and apparently there are cinnamon buns every AM at 8. I JUST FOUND MY SATURDAY MORNING EARLY RISE INCENTIVE.

mVdizLc9LcWsWY-NgWZzCA.text: Wonderful little breakfast shop - you'll love their coffees, chai tea, and delicious selection of cakes & breakfast options. Not a huge menu but everything is done to perfection. 10/10

MmAugJjbrZ5OxyhiOFvh4g.text: So darling from the staff to the cafe itself. I was so impressed with their coffee selection and their food options too. Absolutely loved this little hidden treasure. Great for breakfast, time with your girlfriends or a quick bite. Being here made me feel like I was in a secret garden  loved it. Great food for vegetarians!

photos.caption: Photo of Bloomsbury Coffee House - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bloomsbury Coffee House - London, United Kingdom. Veggie sausage and egg and an english muffin

OZM5bog9jzboVYQCSaX8kQ.text: I really like the interior of this place. Reminds me of some of the furniture places in the city, in a good way. It's a small place. I have a thing for basement cafes and become addicted to them as I have been to a lot in London. The coffee was actually good. I just had a coffee while I read the London Standard. Customer service was good.

BjktOJIOhcuTvCToKo0TBg.text: First of all, this coffee shop provided me with the best croissant I've had in all of England - it was soft and chewy on the inside but crisp and flaky on the outside. It set my day off to a perfect start. The coffee was also good. The vibe of the cafe is pretty chill - many guests coming in and out throughout the day. The wi-fi is fast, and the employees do not seem to mind you sitting for a while to get some work done. Around lunchtime, there is a wide variety of quiches and sandwiches available as well, and there are several vegetable mixes that looked extremely appetizing though I did not have a chance to try them.It's really close to UCL and SOAS, making it super convenient for college students. Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bloomsbury Coffee House - London, United Kingdom. Perfect breakfast; fresh croissant and Americano black

thZzdTi_7gcKhRc46_uWJA.text: Great espresso, free WiFi and friendly staff. A little stuffy but overall a great spot for coffee and visiting.
